intro: Catopsis alba, commonly known as the white catopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central pool to collect rainwater. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in the spring. Catopsis alba is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
